Input: There was a child named Siony who had a brother named Nenu that loved music. Siony was 5 years old and the family was poor. They found out that John Deacon loved music, and wanted to make a record called John Deacon Does Good. In November 1966, John Deacon released his first single, and the song sold 75,000 copies, and the next month Siony and Nenu made a music video for the single named Siony Has a Brother. Nenu had 5 more songs to make, and he made another music video named Nenu Does More. The family was able to buy some clothes and furniture, but they were still very poor, so when January came, they decided to move into the basement and have a family party on that month instead of New Years Eve 1966. With 4 more records to make, and money for furniture and clothes, and enough to do that, the family began having a music party every Saturday night. What are the 6 songs Nenu made on the first Saturday of January 1969?
Output: 6 – 2 – 7 – 4 – 3 – 1 – 0

Input: A patient is in a hospital suffering from pneumonia. He has had severe coughing attacks so many times during his time in the hospital that he is starting to lose consciousness. The doctor sends him home. There, the doctor is worried that the coughing will happen again and that it may result in a serious infection. Because the doctor doesn't want the patient to continue coughing, he brings in a nurse to help him. The nurse tells the patient that she will hold his coat, wipe down his hands and arms, and cover his mouth. This helps the cough disappear, but the coughing will get worse. The nurse takes his coat off, wipes his hands, and covers his mouth, but the coughing does not go away and when the nurse tries to leave, she falls to the floor and cannot get up. The patient is brought back into the room on oxygen, but the coughing still won't stop. The nurse can't think of anything else to do and is willing to do anything to help the patient. The doctor is not going to wait around. He wants the patient to undergo a surgery that will remove some tissue in his lung that has broken off. After the surgery is complete, the doctor tells the patient that he won't be able to breathe without a tube in his throat for at least six weeks. It will be a hard process for the patient to go through. Because the doctor hopes this will stop the cough, he doesn't want the patient, who continues to cough, to go to the hospital for care. The doctor then tells the patient that he will be sent home in 30 minutes. He goes on to say that he will be fine for two years. This may sound tough for the patient, but is the best thing the doctor will do. He has to face and help the consequences of his choice, and by being proactive with the patient he can prevent a serious situation. He will be able to take away the pain he is causing his patient and by being proactive, he can avoid any other situations that could have an even harsher toll on the patient. It is also important to be proactive rather than reactive.

Feedback from the lesson:

- We discussed how there would be more questions in the future, as well as how to give and receive feedback.

- The problems for the lesson were challenging, and sometimes had questions that the students could not come up with an answer to themselves right away.

- It was also interesting to see if students learned things from each other about the problem they were working on, and how it affected their own situations.

- Finally, we also learned a little bit about the differences in how problems were solved in the past.

- We also discussed ways we could improve this lesson. For instance, we could have had the students choose which of their 2 friends they needed to give feedback to, and the questions we would have asked them. This way, if they wanted to avoid giving feedback to someone else, they could have avoided giving feedback at all.

- Thank you for helping us write an informative assessment.

Input and Output

Input and output means the output of the question is usually found below the input, that is it is the input that gives the answer to the question and the answer to the question is an output.

Input and output can be combined with question choices to make a sum of all possible choices.

input and output can be combined to make a sum with different types of question. For example, input and output can be combined for a sum with a question containing both the word "and" and "or"

Output and input are used the same way as answer and answer combinations, except a "and" in the answer could add an otherwise possible value.

Input for: "What is the most common way for a student to make out?"
Output to: "You get 25% wrong.

Input:The following story was told to me by one of my friends in her 20's who grew up in Chicago, IN.

When her mother moved them out to the country in the mid-1960's, they had no furniture.

She was working in the restaurant one night when their landlord came into the kitchen. He had some furniture in his hand.

He said, "I just put a bunch of furniture in my box in my bedroom.
I'm moving."

She knew something was wrong. She immediately asked him what was wrong, but he shook his head at her.

She said she didn't want to get married. He started crying as he said that, and this only made his wife more upset. The landlord left, but just came back in a few minutes later.

He said he had taken everything he could fit into his box, but was still going to move.

He said that after he had moved, the furniture and their neighbors' furniture were gone.

My friend was hurt at first, but realized that was not going to stop him.

As it got dark, she realized that since she had moved to the country, she would not be coming home anymore either.

She said goodbye to her friend, and walked out to her car to get her things.

The car was empty.

That night, her boss called her and said, "you will be laid off.
This is your last day."

Then one Saturday night her boss went to his church and heard a piano playing.

He recognized the song.

He played the lyrics and her name came up at the end.

He called her right away and told her she was fired.

She laughed and said, "I'm going to marry that guy."

She said the wedding was not going to happen.

Her friend said she had to marry him, because the song said they both have to, because of this verse which is: "And I am the bridegroom."

This is a nice story that I love it. I love the fact that even though she had to move to the country, she still got married. Also the part where she laughed when she read this verse at the end.
Also it's funny because at the end she said that her boss would never have to play this song again, because of this verse.
Thank you for reading my story,

1

Input:The cost per box of cereal depends on how much extra is added to the selling price. If the selling price per case is set at 100, then there will be 50 cases ready at a time. If the selling price of cereal is set at 60, the price per case will be 100. The difference between the selling price (100) and the cost per case (60) is the selling price per box. The difference between the cost per case (100) and the selling price (60) is the cost per case per case. The difference between the total cost of each case and the selling price is the selling price per case multiplied by the number of cases each box is available. Therefore, the sales price per case is equal to the selling price per box multiplied by the number of boxes in each case. The same applies for the value of the boxes compared to the value of any cereal purchased during a time. If the value of a box is $5, then the value of cereal purchased during that time is $35, and the selling price per case for that cereal is $2. It all adds up to $35.
Input: $1.50 per box
Output: $35 = $2.00 per box

Feeding a Parrot

In our free time, we like to feed our parrots. Often, they do this themselves. This is because parrots are smart, very social animals and will benefit from it. Parrots do better when they have something tasty to eat. A parrot that can only eat toast will suffer from obesity.

Feeding Tips

The food we give the parrot should be simple and easy for us to prepare. This way, the bird can become familiar with it. We should not prepare the food very often. We should not make it too fresh or too salty. Our aim is to make the food simple so the birds will be able to figure out how to get it.

The parrot should have plenty of things that he can get his mouth around. He should have something to grab on to and something to chew onto, otherwise he will quickly get bored. We will focus on things that are easy for him (or other parrots) to get a hold of. The key is to avoid getting too messy. When you need to get a parrot, you need to be prepared for a lot of cleaning up! Parrots like to eat food and they like having their hands on things so they cannot let anything get out of hand when eating. We cannot force a bird into doing anything but what it likes eating. He will do what he wants to do. We have seen and heard of parrots eating pieces of wood, string, wires, and even the insides of their own toys. We would like to avoid any sharp objects when giving a parrot something to chew, chew on or even bite. We do encourage him to have fun with food in some way (a bird that eats nothing is bored).

To feed the bird we should put something around the piece of food that we feed him. We should make it visible to him so he is aware of what he has to do. For example, he should be able to see the fruits of his labor, the food we prepared and what he was able to eat. We should make the fruit and vegetables visible so the bird knows there is food out there to eat. We want to keep the bird occupied and busy until it learns something new.

When giving the parrot food, we will need

* Some animals have names that have both a meaning and a name. Some animals that are named after a species, can take on multiple meanings, depending on the animal’s nature.

* Some known species are dog breeds and their relatives. For example, this could be “Blue” for Boxers, “Rottweiler” for Rottweilers, or “Bruski” for “Bruski Dog”.

(This can be done in one single page, but if it has multiple pages each containing images it should be formatted in a single file.) * The page should contain some information about the activity (for example, the title, what the activity is, and the purpose of the activity.) * The page should include a link from this web page to YouTube or Vimeo, which are widely used for educational material. (If uploading an image to YouTube please make sure to check the "Post to YouTube" box.)
* The participant must include their name, email address, and phone number. This information is very important in order to receive credit for the submission.
* All activity submissions and work, in any format including Word, must be approved by the instructor(s).

You can find and report inappropriate submissions to the MSSC Office.

The thing is, you don't have to be wealthy to donate and give in a very meaningful way. I read that you can buy books from the library or buy a gift certificate for Toys for Tots. The nice thing about it is that no one has to feel guilty about not being able to donate because it's the holidays and so much of the money is spent on family.

A big portion of our daily lives is spent caring for others, either through our own giving, helping others through charity, helping out businesses to boost the economy, working, schooling, and other things to help the world out, and on and on. But so many people (even around the world) do not have the luxury of being able to do all that. We just see one person being given a book, or an extra dollar here or there from donations, and what is it doing for them? If all the money was donated to the person receiving all the donated money, they could make a difference in the lifetime of that person. That is what this was all about in our story. These children are in need of the books for their new years, and we need to give, as well.

There are 3 monkeys in the rain forest. They run around, play and have a good time. Then, one of the monkeys, named Mr. Banana, says:
"I want to come to the zoo!"
But the zoo is closed for the season and when they reopen they ask Mr. Banana to get a job.
The other 2 monkeys are named Mrs. Banana and Mr. Banana.
Mr. Banana asks:
"What kind of a job can I have? How long for? What is the salary?"
Those are the questions that they ask and they give Mr. Banana a job, then the zoo opens again, so Mr. Banana stays for another month.
Next month Mr. Banana gets another job and now he is on a salary of $3,000 and gets to hang out with all the other monkeys.
The next monkey in line is Mr. Banana with 8 more weeks of freedom!
Next is Mrs. Banana. They ask her a lot of questions. What is her job? How long is it? And how can they pay for the zoo bills every month?
Then the monkey with the most time is Mr. Banana, he works the longest. Mr. Banana tells the other monkeys,
"If we are going to the zoo again, then I want to go with Mrs. Banana! She's very fun."
So they all go.
Later a monkey named Bob says to his girlfriend,
"What's the purpose of the zoo? I can't imagine spending so much time there!"
Then Mr. Banana responds,
"I'm not a zoo and am not going to be a zoo. But if Bob is staying here, he is going to have to work for Mrs. Banana. They can't give him extra years!"
Next is a small monkey named Charlie, with 2 more weeks to go.
Mr. Banana is still in charge. He will take Charlie to the zoo and help out Charlie again. Then Charlie goes back home.
Then the zoo is closed for another season. Mr. Banana is given another job and now it is just the 2 of the other monkeys left.
Then the zoo closes for a third time. Mr. Banana and the other monkeys, who now have the exact same number of hours worked, are now on a $2 each per hour salary.
By this time Mr. Banana is very sick, so he sends his friends back home. Now only Mr. Banana and Bob are left working.

D

At the end of the trip the man, thinking that the woman hadn't cooked yet, asked her if she wanted to have dinner. The woman said, "I haven't cooked yet, but I will eat now." The man said, "No more!" She got up and said, "I was going to cook some hot dogs on a fire and I thought you would like to eat them. Now how about an ice-cream sandwich?" The man thought this was an interesting meal and took it, but he wasn't hungry when they finished and said, "We'll have an ice-cream later." The woman said, "OK." He left and the woman went to look at the bugs. She was disappointed. She thought her bug net was the wrong shape and was disappointed that her fire didn't work right. Then she realized that the bug net was made from a sheet of paper and she looked through it and saw that the top half was on her, while the bottom half was on the other person, and that she was able to control the fire. The dog comes closer to the red and white dog and the two of them start running at full speed towards the enemy. At one point, the dog hits the red and white soldier, and the soldier, now on the ground, looks back and states, "We are both going to die!" The man runs up to the dog and says, "I will not die, sir. I have the means to pay for some of the expenses you may and I shall not die." The dog replies, "Sir, we are both already dead, and why can't you move us?" The soldier continues, "If I push the man, and the dog together, I can pull us both out, but one will have to survive to pull the other."
